title: "Unable to Connect to Server" Loading Error HELP
body:
Hi all,
   I recently upgraded my home internet, as well as adding new modem, and since then league has been giving me this issue. The game seems to run perfectly fine until after champ select I'm presented with a black screen instead of the normal loading screen displaying all the players. After a few moment an error box appears telling me that i was unable to connect to the servers. trying to reconnect to the game gives the same error, even if I close the client down completely, reload it and attempt to reconnect then, the same error appears.

Here's what I've tried:
-reinstalling LoL(which interestingly enough, seemed to have fixed the issue for about 2 games or so, after that the same problem persisted once again)
-Checking all my firewall settings to ensure league of legends is permitted
-repairing the league client
-Disabling IP-helper
-restarting my computer

   The closest I've seen through searching the internet looking for a fix is that it could be possible that the modem I'm using is incompatible with the league servers, which to me doesn't really make any sense...

Any and all information regarding this issue is welcome, I'm at a complete loss with this one.

   -Thank you.

*currently on windows 10*

replies.body:
Some modems ship with firmware that blocks League due to their default configurations, such as Hitron Hubs. Since your key context here is making a change to your network equipment, it would be a good idea to take the steps inside of our [connection guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues), specifically the port forwarding step. 

Let me know if this helped resolve the issue.

Hey there thanks for the reply, i checked out the connection guide and i made a few more attempts to solve my issue, unfortunately to no avail. I tried port forwarding, as well as flushing my DNS and renewing my ip, which seemed to have no effect, let me know if you need any additional information for me to provide.

I recommend reaching out to our tech team so they can investigate further. You can run a set of logs using our [Hextech Repair Tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367) and a [Network Analysis](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq1), then attach them to your [support ticket request.](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new)

While waiting for a tech to grab your ticket, I recommend reaching out to your ISP and requesting they push a Firmware update to your modem. This can sometimes be the quick fix for this issue. Let me know if you have any questions.
